facelet-taglib.description: The Liferay Faces Alloy facelet component tags with the showcase: tag name prefix.

function.description: Returns a URL representing the specified JavaDoc key.
Returns an escaped representation of the specified client ID.
Returns the client ID associated with the specified expression.

tag.description: Accordion is a UIData (iterator) component that renders child tabs either statically or dynamically.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Integer representing the zero-based index representing the selected tab.
attribute.name: selectedIndex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description:
The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property. The value can be any of the following types:
  • Any concrete subclass of DataModel
  • Array (automatically wrapped with ArrayDataModel)
  • java.util.Collection (automatically wrapped with CollectionDataModel)
  • java.util.List (automatically wrapped with ListDataModel)
  • java.sql.ResultSet (automatically wrapped with ResultSetDataModel)
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be introduced into the EL representing the current iteration.
attribute.name: var

tag.description: ButtonRow is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element for grouping purposes. Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keypress event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: Column is a UIColumn component that renders a div with CSS class name col-#{size}-#{span} (for example: col-md-1 or col-lg-5).

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the APPLY_REQUEST_VALUES, PROCESS_VALIDATIONS, UPDATE_MODEL_VALUES, and INVOKE_APPLICATION phases of the JSF lifecycle. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none, @parent. The default value is @parent (meaning, the parent showcase:dataTable).
attribute.name: execute

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:dataTabe, this is the JavaBean property that is to be used for filtering.
attribute.name: filterBy

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:dataTable, this is the name of the CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute of the table's <td> element inside the <tfoot> element.
attribute.name: footerClass

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:dataTable, this is the name of the CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute of the table's <th> element inside the <thead> element.
attribute.name: headerClass

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:dataTable, this is the text for the column header. This attribute can be used as a convenience instead of specifying a child <f:facet name="header" /> tag.
attribute.name: headerText

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row, this is the width that the column will be offset by as a unit from 1 to 12. This value is rendered as a CSS class as col-#{size}-offset-#{offset} (for example if offset="4", the CSS class rendered will be col-#{size}-offset-4). If both the offsetWidth and offset attributes are present, the offsetWidth attribute determines the value of the offset. Please consider using offsetWidth.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:row, this is the width that the column will be offset by as a percent. This value selects the offset via the formula offset = (offsetWidth/100)*12 (rounded to the nearest whole number). If both the offsetWidth and offset attributes are present, the offsetWidth attribute determines the value of the offset.
attribute.name: offsetWidth

attribute.description: Space-delimited list of component ids that are to participate in the RENDER_RESPONSE phase of the JSF lifecycle and be re-rendered in the DOM after the response is received from the XmlHttpRequest. The following keywords may also appear in the list: @this, @form, @all, @none, @parent. The default value is @parent (meaning, the parent showcase:dataTable).
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:row and this flag is true, then the column is to be rendered as a <th> element with scope=row.
attribute.name: rowHeader

attribute.description: When alloy:column is a child of alloy:row, this is the size of the column. This value is rendered as a CSS class as col-#{size}-#{span} (for example if size="medium", the CSS class rendered will be col-md-#{span}). Valid values include "extra-small" (or "xs"), "small" (or "sm"), "medium" (or "md"), and "large" (or "lg"). The default value is "medium".
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:dataTabe, this is the JavaBean property that is to be used for sorting.
attribute.name: sortBy

attribute.description: Indicates the sort order for the column. Valid values are ascending, descending, and none.
attribute.name: sortOrder

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:row, this is the width of this column as a unit from 1 to 12. This value is rendered as a CSS class as col-#{size}-#{span} (for example if span="4", the CSS class rendered will be col-#{size}-4). If both the width and span attributes are present, the width attribute determines the value of the span number. Please consider using width.
attribute.name: span

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: When showcase:column is a child of showcase:row, this is the width of the column as a percent. This value selects the span number via the formula span = (width/100)*12 (rounded to the nearest whole number). If both the width and span attributes are present, the width attribute determines the value of the span number.
attribute.name: width

tag.description: Container is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element and a <label> element in order to wrap/decorate results. Since it extends PanelGroup, it supports all the features of showcase:panelGroup.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies whether the HTML element rendered by this component will be a div (default) or a span. If the value of this attribute is block, the rendered element will be a div.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keypress event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: DataItem is a UIColumn component component that is designed to be used as a child of DataList and renders its children inside a <li> or <dt> element.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: DataList is a UIData (iterator) component that renders <ul> (unordered), <ol> (ordered), or <dl> (description) lists.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The type of the list to render. Valid values are "unordered", "ordered" and "description". The default value is "unordered".
attribute.name: type

attribute.description:
The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property. The value can be any of the following types:
  • Any concrete subclass of DataModel
  • Array (automatically wrapped with ArrayDataModel)
  • java.util.Collection (automatically wrapped with CollectionDataModel)
  • java.util.List (automatically wrapped with ListDataModel)
  • java.sql.ResultSet (automatically wrapped with ResultSetDataModel)
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be introduced into the EL representing the current iteration.
attribute.name: var

tag.description: Example is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element. Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The description the component.
attribute.name: description

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies whether the HTML element rendered by this component will be a span (default) or a div. If the value of this attribute is "block", the rendered element will be a div.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: The number of the example. The default value is 0.
attribute.name: number

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not a "Rendered" checkbox should be included. The default value is false.
attribute.name: renderedCheckbox

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not a "Required" checkbox should be included. The default value is false.
attribute.name: requiredCheckbox

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: Field is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element and a <label> element in order to wrap a field. Since it extends PanelGroup, it supports all the features of showcase:panelGroup.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The text value for the rendered <label> element.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the label will be rendered before the rendered children. The default value is true.
attribute.name: labelFirst

attribute.description: Specifies whether the HTML element rendered by this component will be a div (default) or a span. If the value of this attribute is block, the rendered element will be a div.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: Icon is a component that renders a span which contains an icon specified by the name attribute.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The color of the icon which this component will render. Valid values include black (the default) and white.
attribute.name: color

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The icon which this component will render. A list of valid icons can be found at Bootstrap Base CSS. Note: icon names must be specified without the glyphicon glyphicon- prefix.
attribute.name: name

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: Note is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element with with a special icon representing a note.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.

tag.description: outputSourceCode is an HtmlOutputText component that delegates rendering to its JSF renderer.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the reading direction for the element For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When false, markup will not be escaped. The default value is true.
attribute.name: escape

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in the element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: The name of the programming language that the editor is editing or displaying.
attribute.name: mode

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the various WAI-ARIA roles that the element is used for. Since: JSF 2.2
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Panel is a UIPanel component that renders a <div> element with three child <div> elements (one for header, body, and footer). Since it extends HtmlPanelGroup, it supports all the features of h:panelGroup.

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies whether the HTML element rendered by this component will be a span (default) or a div. If the value of this attribute is "block", the rendered element will be a div.
attribute.name: layout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.

attribute.description: Specifies whether the HTML element rendered by this component will be a span (default) or a div. If the value of this attribute is "block", the rendered element will be a div.

tag.description: Tab is a panel component that renders nested/child tags as content within itself.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.

attribute.description: When showcase:tab is a child of showcase:accordion, this is the name of the CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute of the content <div>

attribute.description:
The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property. The value can be any of the following types:
  • Any concrete subclass of DataModel
  • Array (automatically wrapped with ArrayDataModel)
  • java.util.Collection (automatically wrapped with CollectionDataModel)
  • java.util.List (automatically wrapped with ListDataModel)
  • java.sql.ResultSet (automatically wrapped with ResultSetDataModel)
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be introduced into the EL representing the current iteration.
attribute.name: var
